title: Fred Moore (boxer)
text:
Fred Moore, alias Fabulous (born February 26, 1967), is a <a href="light%20heavyweight">light heavyweight</a> professional <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> from <a href="Minnesota">Minnesota</a>.
Personal life.
Moore was born in <a href="Philadelphia%2C%20Pennsylvania">Philadelphia</a>, <a href="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</a>, but now makes his home in <a href="Rochester%2C%20Minnesota">Rochester</a>, <a href="Minnesota">Minnesota</a>. He has 2 daughters, Shaniqua, 19, Arnella, 14.
Professional career.
Moore debuted in November 1994 and won the first 25 fights of his career before dropping a fight by <a href="Knockout">TKO</a> to <a href="Quincy%20Taylor">Quincy Taylor</a> in June 2001. In his career, Moore has fought <a href="Kenny%20Bowman">Kenny Bowman</a>, <a href="Quincy%20Taylor">Quincy Taylor</a>, <a href="Reggie%20Johnson%20%28boxer%29">Reggie Johnson</a>, and <a href="Glen%20Johnson%20%28boxer%29">Glen Johnson</a>, among others. As of October 2007, Moore's professional record was 30 wins (27 by <a href="knockout">knockout</a>) and 7 losses.
Fred Moore grew up in the Scotland School for Veterans' Children in Scotland, PA where he earned the title of the best fighter in the school.
